text.9_Daf, 10_Line: Blessed is Israel; for when they occupy themselves with Torah and acts of kindness their inclination is mastered by them, and they are not mastered by their inclination, as it is said,
text.21_Daf, 47_Line: Such as the fair in Gaza.
text.22_Daf, 16_Line: If his coins got scattered in front of an idol he should not bend and pick them up, for it looks as if he is bowing to the idol; but if this is not apparent it is permitted.
text.19_Daf, 53_Line: What about this Keti’ah b. Shalom?
text.20_Daf, 60_Line: It is permitted to mutilate [an animal] at royal funerals and this is not prohibited as the “ways of the Amorites”!
text.11_Daf, 20_Line: When they said it was prohibited to engage in business with them [before their festivals] this applies only to unperishable items but not to perishable items; and even in the case of unperishable items, if the transaction is made, [the proceeds] are permitted.
text.14_Daf, 53_Line: The prohibition applies only to those who celebrate it.
text.7_Daf, 58_Line: “Buy the truth and sell it not,” (Proverbs 23:23) the Holy Blessed One will not go beyond the letter of the law; judgment, about which it is not written “truth,” the Holy Blessed One may go beyond the letter of the law [towards mercy].
text.8_Daf, 7_Line: The saying of David the son of Jesse, the man who elevated the yoke of repentance.
text.28_Daf, 7_Line: What is the reason for this?
